did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Photocopies of typed transcriptions. Some are royal orders, 1784- 1786, directed to Bishop Antonio de los Reyes, concerning the custodial settlement of the missions and missionaries. The individual documents are noted as being copies and signed by the officials Miguel Ant. Cuevas at Alamos and Christoval Carvalan at Arizpe. Also includes some letters from Reyes to Viceroy Martías de Galvez about the urgent need to establish the Custodia of San Carlos. The final section has reports for Visitor General José de Gálvez.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Spanish Franciscan; consecrated as the first Bishop of Sonora, Sinaloa, and the two Californias in 1782.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by type of document.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of typed transcriptions. Some are royal orders, 1784- 1786, directed to Bishop Antonio de los Reyes, concerning the custodial settlement of the missions and missionaries. The individual documents are noted as being copies and signed by the officials Miguel Ant. Cuevas at Alamos and Christoval Carvalan at Arizpe. Also includes some letters from Reyes to Viceroy Martías de Galvez about the urgent need to establish the Custodia of San Carlos. The final section has reports for Visitor General José de Gálvez.

relatedmaterial.p: In part, photocopies from the Archivo General de la Nación, Mexico City, and the Bancroft Library, Berkeley.

item.corpname: Franciscans -- Missions -- Mexico -- Sonora (State) -- History -- 18th century.
